text:
Since this whole recovery partition business is occupying a ton of all our time.
Does anyone know if there is a way to tell windows to generate a recovery
partition if none is enabled? I don’t mean create a partition, I mean, you make
a 1Gb partition by whatever means and you execute something so that windows
considers it a recovery partition and writes whatever it needs to that
partition. 
I’m also finding that 2024-01 CU update for server is failing on servers due to
the same issue. Recreating the recovery partition seems to fix the problem, when
its possible. Some vms have a recovery partition before the system partition and
the partition is too small, which seems to be the issue. 
For these ones, the fastest solution is to extend the disk, create a partition
and enable that partition as a recovery partition, replacing the existing one. 
But how? 
I’ve found quite a few workstations which have no recovery partition at all.
They could be redimensioned and a dedicated partition created, but how to enable
the partition as a recovery one? 
Ian Murphy 
[cid:image001.png@01DA4BFF.0D100BB0] 
 
[cid:image002.png@01DA4BFF.0D100BB0] 
946 21 52 65 [tel:946%2021%2052%2065]

[cid:image004.png@01DA4BFF.0D100BB0] 
www.integra-xp.com
 
[cid:image005.png@01DA4BFF.0D100BB0] 
Sasikoa, 26 ‑ 2º CD

Sus datos no son cedidos a terceros ajenos a Integra Experience S.L. En todo

un email a , así como el derecho a presentar una reclamación
ante la Agencia Española de Protección de Datos. 
El contenido de este correo electrónico y de sus anexos es estrictamente
confidencial. En el supuesto de que Vd. no sea el destinatario y haya recibido
este mensaje por error, le agradeceremos que lo comunique al remitente, sin
difundir, almacenar o copiar su contenido. 
--
